Sure, here are some specific examples of how Cyril Ramaphosa's policies have attracted foreign investment to South Africa:

1. Investment Conferences: Since his election in 2018, Ramaphosa has hosted two investment conferences aimed at attracting investment into the country. In 2018, the conference secured investment commitments worth $20.6 billion from both domestic and foreign investors. In 2019, the conference generated pledges worth $11.4 billion.

2. Business-friendly policies: Ramaphosa has implemented policies to make the business environment more friendly and attractive to investors. For instance, he introduced changes to visa regulations to make it easier for tourists and investors to visit the country. He has also pledged to reduce bureaucratic hurdles for investors who want to start businesses in South Africa.

3. Infrastructure development: The South African government has prioritized infrastructure development, with a focus on sectors such as energy, transport, and telecommunications. This has been attractive to investors looking to invest in these areas.

4. Agriculture: South Africa has a large agricultural sector, and Ramaphosa's government has prioritized investment in this area. For instance, the government has launched initiatives to boost agricultural production and exports, which has attracted investors interested in this sector.

Overall, these policies and initiatives have helped to increase investor confidence and attracted significant foreign investment into South Africa under Cyril Ramaphosa's leadership.
